author: David Maddock
title: Liverpool braced for FIFA fight over Joel Matip ban after Cameroon defender snubs AFCON call-up
text:
Matip has enjoyed a fine first season in the Premier League (Photo: 2016 Getty Images) Share Get Liverpool FC updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Liverpool are bracing themselves for a fight with FIFA over star defender Joel Matip over a possible one-month ban. 
The centre half was this week called up by his country Cameroon for the Africa Cup of Nations, which begins in Gabon on January 14, despite insisting he had retired from international football more than a year ago. 
Matip – who is currently injured - has refused to go, but it has emerged he could be banned from playing by the world governing body for the duration of the tournament, which lasts until February 5. 
Cameroon boss Hugo Broos has refused to back down in his confrontation with the player, and named him in the squad for the finals, along with seven other players who have said they will not play. Matip in action for Liverpool (Photo: John Powell) Matip is closing in on a return to action (Photo: Getty Images) 
He will now go to FIFA and insist they implement rules which state the player must travel, whether he is injured or not. The rules also state that if he doesn’t travel, then the player can be banned for the entire length of the tournament. 
The rules even demand that the FA intervenes if the deadlock continues, and the English game’s governing body could also be sanctioned, along with Liverpool, if they do not act. Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now
